title: News Article
description: Schema for GPU Agent news articles

id.description: Unique identifier for the article. Use format: 'gpu' + MMDD + abbreviated month + YYYY + 3 random lowercase letters (e.g., 'gpu1212dec2025xyz')

slug.description: URL-friendly slug for the article. Use lowercase words separated by hyphens that briefly describe the topic (e.g., 'quake-ii-rtx-benchmark-launch')

title.description: Title of the article. Should be descriptive and specific. Avoid clickbait. Examples: 'GPU Database Update: 9 New Graphics Cards Added', 'Real-World Gaming Benchmarks Meet Live GPU Pricing'

content.description: Markdown content of the article. Write in a natural, conversational tone. Use first person when referring to site decisions. Include internal links using markdown format [text](/path). For GPU pages use /gpu/learn/card/{slug}, for rankings use /gpu/ranking/gaming/{metric-slug}, for shop pages use /gpu/shop/{slug}. Use ## headers to organize sections. Keep paragraphs short and scannable. Include specific numbers and data points. Avoid overly enthusiastic language (thrilled, delighted, excited), excessive superlatives (incredible, amazing, revolutionary), corporate jargon (leverage, synergy), and formulaic phrases (it's important to note, it's worth mentioning). Be direct, factual, and specific.

status.description: Publication status. Use 'DRAFT' for work in progress, 'PUBLISHED' for live articles, 'ARCHIVED' for removed articles

tags.description: Tags for categorizing the article. Common tags: feature, update, benchmarks, gaming, nvidia, amd, intel, performance, value, ray-tracing, database. Include tags for specific GPU architectures or games mentioned

authorFullName.description: Full name of the article author. Default: 'Scott Willeke'

createdAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the article was created (e.g., '2025-12-12T10:00:00Z')

updatedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the article was last updated. Initially same as createdAt

publishedAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the article was published. Usually same as createdAt for new articles
